Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
NAICS Translation: 541690: Other Scientific and Technical Consulting Services
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: To resolve an investigation by the Federal Communications Commission's Enforcement Bureau, AT&T and its former subsidiary Southern New England Telephone (SNET) agreed to pay a toltal of $10.9 million in penalties for overbilling the FCC's Lifeline program, a program which helps ensure low income consumers have access to a phone line.
Info Source: https://apps.fcc.gov/edocs_public/attachmatch/DOC-333257A1.pdf
Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Agency: Washington State Department of Labor & Industries
Info Source: Contained in data obtained on May 15, 2017 in response to an open records request.

Description: The New York Attorney General announced that as a result of its investigation of internet speeds, Frontier Communications was being required to spend no less than an additional $25 million to upgrade its network infrastructure upstate to relieve congestion and improve service.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20181228133840/https://ag.ny.gov/press-release/ag-underwood-announces-settlements-establishing-industry-wide-standards-marketing

Description: The West Virginia Attorney General announced an estimated $160 million settlement with Frontier Communications to resolve complaints involving Internet speeds provided to consumers. Most of the total would go toward capital expenditures.
Info Source: Attorney General Morrisey Reaches $160M Settlement with Frontier Communications, Targeted News Service, December 10, 2015 (via Nexis).
https://web.archive.org/web/20101110033702/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2009/oct/oct5a_09.html
https://web.archive.org/web/20101111173815/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2006/mar/mar01a_06.html

Company: Southern New England Telephone and Woodbury Telephone
Description: Southern New England Telephone and Woodbury Telephone agreed to pay refunds to customers who had been charged rental for rotary telephones they had never possessed or had returned. Between them 748 customers were refunded $561,000
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20061219060532/http://www.ct.gov/ag/cwp/view.asp?A=1777&Q=283578

Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/foia/files/20190927FrontierERCAMARedacted.pdf

Description: Frontier Communications Corp., Frontier Communications of America, Inc., Frontier Communications of Minnesota, Inc., and Citizens Telecommunications Company of Minnesota, LLC agreed to pay $750,000 (planned for restitution) in settlement of allegations they used deceptive practices to overcharge customers and improperly marketed internet services that did not reach advertised speed or reliability.
Info Source: https://www.ag.state.mn.us/Office/Communications/2020/07/13_Frontier.asp

Description: Frontier Communications Corp., Frontier Communications Northwest, Inc., and Frontier Connunications ILEC Holdings LLC agreed to pay $900,000 in settlement of allegations they used deceptive practices to overcharge customers and improperly marketed internet services that did not reach advertised speed or reliability.
Info Source: https://agportal-s3bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/uploadedfiles/Another/News/Press_Releases/2020_07_07FrontierAOD.pdf

Company: Frontier Communications of New York, Inc.
Description: The New York State Public Service Commission has accepted the terms of settlements valued at $86.2 million regarding alleged violations committed by four New York utilities--Consolidated Edison of New York, Orange & Rockland Utilities, Inc., Central Hudson Gas & Electric Corporation, and Frontier Communications of New York, Inc.--for failing to adequately prepare for and respond to emergencies, including Tropical Storm Isaias in 2020.
Info Source: https://www3.dps.ny.gov/pscweb/WebFileRoom.nsf/ArticlesByCategory/7EABAE22E7EFA31F85258713005B5B7B/$File/gov%20announces_$86.2%20million%20in%20settlements%204%20utilities%20for%20failures%20related%20to%20power%20outages_emergency%20response%20ts%20isaias%20%20.pdf?OpenElement

Description: The New York State Public Service Commission adopted a $5 million settlement that resolved penalty amounts for alleged violations against Frontier Telephone for failing to comply with the terms and conditions of the Commission's utility pole attachment rules.
Info Source: https://www3.dps.ny.gov/pscweb/WebFileRoom.nsf/ArticlesByCategory/7006C8F6BC0FB5208525872F005A819B/$File/pr21082.pdf?OpenElement
